articles.author: FATIMA HUSSEIN
articles.description: WEST PALM BEACH, Fla. (AP) — President-elect Donald Trump declared a win on stopping illegal immigration through Mexico on Wednesday after talking with that country’s leader. But Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum suggested Mexico was already doing its part and had no interest in closing its borders.
articles.title: Trump claims a win on immigration after a call with Mexico's president. But she suggests no change

articles.author: JILL COLVIN and ALANNA DURKIN RICHER
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — A number of President-elect Donald Trump 's most prominent Cabinet picks and appointees have been targeted by bomb threats and “swatting attacks," Trump's transition team said Wednesday.
articles.title: Trump transition says Cabinet picks, appointees were targeted by bomb threats, swatting attacks

articles.author: LOLITA C. BALDOR and FATIMA HUSSEIN
articles.description: WEST PALM BEACH, Fla. (AP) — President-elect Donald Trump said Wednesday that he has chosen Keith Kellogg, a highly decorated retired three-star general, to serve as his special envoy for Ukraine and Russia.
articles.title: Trump selects longtime adviser Keith Kellogg as special envoy for Ukraine and Russia

articles.author: BASSEM MROUE, KAREEM CHEHAYEB and TIA GOLDENBERG
articles.description: TYRE, Lebanon (AP) — Thousands of Lebanese displaced by the war between Israel and Hezbollah militants returned home Wednesday as a ceasefire took hold, driving cars stacked with personal belongings and defying warnings from Lebanese and Israeli troops to avoid some areas.
articles.title: Thousands of Lebanese return to their homes as Israel-Hezbollah ceasefire takes hold

articles.author: HANNA ARHIROVA and BARRY HATTON
articles.description: KYIV, Ukraine (AP) — Russia conducted a “massive” attack against Ukraine’s energy infrastructure on Thursday, firing nearly 200 missiles and drones and leaving more than a million households without power, Ukrainian officials said.
articles.title: Another massive Russian missile and drone attack targets Ukraine's energy infrastructure

articles.description: NAIROBI, Kenya (AP) — At least 13 people have died in eastern Uganda after landslides buried 40 homes in six villages, relief officials said Thursday.The Uganda Red Cross Society said 13 bodies have been recovered and the rescue effort is continuing.
articles.title: At least 13 dead after landslides bury 40 homes in villages in eastern Uganda

articles.author: ERIC TUCKER, AAMER MADHANI and MATTHEW LEE
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Three American citizens imprisoned for years by China have been released and are returning to the United States, the White House said Wednesday, announcing a rare diplomatic agreement with Beijing in the final months of the Biden administration.
articles.title: China releases 3 Americans it imprisoned for years, and Beijing says US returned 4 people to China

articles.author: PAOLA FLORES and ISABEL DEBRE
articles.description: EL ALTO, Bolivia (AP) — Fuel is rapidly becoming one of Bolivia’s scarcest commodities.Long lines of vehicles snake for several kilometers outside gas stations all over Bolivia, once South America’s second-largest producer of natural gas.
articles.title: 'Everything is expensive!' Bolivia faces a shocking economic collapse

articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — A century after the first Macy’s Thanksgiving Day Parade, the annual holiday tradition kicks off Thursday in New York City with new Spider-Man and Minnie Mouse balloons, zoo and pasta-themed floats, performances from Jennifer Hudson and Idina Menzel, and more.
articles.title: Macy’s Thanksgiving Day Parade kicks off a century after its first trip through Manhattan

articles.author: MARK THIESSEN and BECKY BOHRER
articles.description: ANCHORAGE, Alaska (AP) — In the remotest reaches of Alaska, there’s no relying on DoorDash to have Thanksgiving dinner — or any dinner — delivered.
articles.title: 'It's a bird! It's a plane!' In Alaska, it's both, with a pilot tossing turkeys to rural homes
